intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Hup, two, three, four! Hup, two, three, four! Keep it going, Midori. One after the other. You'll get there! Hup, two— But I do hope I'll be there soon. I wouldn't want to keep Father waiting. He's going to be so happy that I found the rare herb he wanted! Got it tucked nice and safe in my little bag here. Hup, two, three— Aaaagh! Am I there yet? I've marched ALL the way from my Deeprealm to meet him! Hup, two, three—uh, hang on. What's that up ahead?

intro.speaker: Boy
intro.line: Help me! Somebody! Anybody!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Shut up! Now empty your pockets like I told you—or I'll CUT 'em open. And I ain't too careful with my knife, if ya know what I mean.

intro.speaker: Boy
intro.line: Leave me alone!

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Wh-what are you doing?! Pick on someone your own size!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: What? Who said that?! Ha! Ain't you a li'l tater.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Nuh-uh! I'm Midori, the biggest herb gatherer around! Now, do the adult thing and put down tour weapons, you...you... You pocket emptier!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: What's that?! Ain't your parents ever teach you to respect your elders? Guess I'll just have to teach you to shut your yap.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Huh? No!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Gaaah!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Midori... I'm here. You're safe.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Father!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Urr, who—? Never mind. I'm gone. Got better pockets to empty.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Thanks a bunch, Father! I hope you weren't too worried. I wasn't.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Is that so? Then maybe do me a favor next time and be on time. I'll always worry. That's my job. Well now. Have you gotten taller again? You're growing faster than bamboo!

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Oh, yes! But it's time that's going by so fast in the Deeprealms. I'm an adult now—or at least more one than that brute was. Anyway, Father, I found the rare herbs you wanted! See? I've got them right here! Er, hold on. They were right here. I had them just a moment ago!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Huh? Did you drop the herbs when that bandit approached you?

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Um...no! I'm sure I didn't drop them!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Hmm...then where are they? Let's just retrace your steps. They must have slipped through your fingers.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: No way. I'm sure I didn't misplace them. I was JUST holding the bag! It must have been that man. He took the herbs from me. Wait here, Father! I'll find that guy and get the bag back.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: No, Midori. Wait!

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Um... Hey, you! Yes, YOU! With the bag! That's mine!

intro.speaker: Candace
intro.line: Eh? Sharp eye, kid. People don't usually see me when I'm tiptoeing around.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Well, the fact is, I'm not a kid. I'm the biggest herb gatherer around! And you're running around with some pretty bad guys!

intro.speaker: Candace
intro.line: Well, if we're comparing facts, I am NOT with these barbarians. I travel among them. They make for a nice distraction while I do my work. No one even sees me walk amid the whole hairy, smelly horde of them! And who am I, you may ask? She who locates legendary riches! A genius! And explorer! I'm none other than Candace, the notorious treasure hunter!

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Um, what? Does this have something to do with my bag? Explain yourself!

intro.speaker: Candace
intro.line: Leave it to Candace! I have explanations for every occasion! You see, I learned that the rare Dragon Herbs were hereabouts! As I've said, I am a treasure hunter. You had something I treasured. The rest is just math. Ergo, what's yours is now mine.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Well, the fact is that I found those herbs first. You stole my bag!

intro.speaker: Candace
intro.line: Facts again? Then let me drop another fact on you. You took the herbs from this forest, didn't you? Wouldn't that make YOU a thief?

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: Nuh-uh!

intro.speaker: Candace
intro.line: Then I'm not a thief either! I could stand here and complain about you dragging my name through the mud. But Candace is going to take the high road—and just say good-bye. You could try to take back your bag. But I'll warn you. I'm quick as a wink.

intro.speaker: Midori
intro.line: No, wait! I need those herbs for my father!

boss.speaker: Candace
boss.line: Oh? Caught up with Candace, did you? Well done. But I'll warn you. I'm strong as an oak!

end.speaker: Midori
end.line: Glad that's over. I wasn't sure we were going to get the herbs back!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Don't scare me like that. Running off on me? I was terrified! All of this, just for those herbs? We could have gathered more. They're not worth the risk of losing you. So never do that again!

end.speaker: Midori
end.line: But I just— Ugh, you don't understand! Those herbs grow here only once every year! And you don't realize the true value of those herbs anyway. Those herbs can make wishes come true!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Huh? I knew they were useful, but they can actually grant wishes?

end.speaker: Midori
end.line: Well the fact is...the herbs can help make one specific wish come true. My wish, in fact—to prove my usefulness to you, Father. So I can stay here!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Midori, we still could have waited for the herbs to grow back. This was risky.

end.speaker: Midori
end.line: Don't you realize?! A year here would be FOREVER in my Deeprealm! And I just can't wait THAT long to prove my usefulness again! I...I...hate it there, away from you!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: I'm sorry that I've put you through all of this, Midori. It was only for your safety. But it seems that you're more than old enough to make your own choices. Forgive me for not realizing what you were going through much earlier. Of course, time is more fleeting in the Deeprealms. I planned to visit as often as I could, since days here would be much longer for you. I am dearly sorry for putting you through such loneliness.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Here, take my hand, Midori. From now on, we walk together in life. No more Deeprealms for you.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Of course! I'll just go let my comrades know that you'll be joining us.

end.speaker: Midori
end.line: Thank you, Father! Now, see? I was right about the power of these herbs! My greatest wish is coming true!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Let's go, Midori. We have a lot to catch up about. I want to know everything about your life in your Deeprealm. I've missed out on so much. Tell me about it all—and don't leave out a single day.

end.speaker: Midori
end.line: Yes, Father. That will surely keep us busy for at least a few years!
